books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A classic novel set in the 1930s about racial injustice and the loss of innocence in a small Alabama town.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A timeless novel about the prejudices and misunderstandings between members of the landed gentry and the emerging middle class.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel about the decadence and excess of the Roaring Twenties, and the disillusionment of the American Dream.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian government and its manipulation of history and information.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about a teenage boy struggling with alienation and growing up in post-World War II America.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comedic science fiction novel about an unwitting human and his alien friend traveling through space.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic fantasy novel about a hobbit who joins a quest to destroy a powerful ring and defeat an evil ruler.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: A novel about seven generations of a Colombian family and their magical realist experiences.

books.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.author: Anne Frank
books.description: A non-fiction diary about a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis in Amsterdam during World War II.
